ref.pp:
/-- Definition 3.6.1 (Equal cardinality) -/
abbrev EqualCard (X Y : Set) : Prop :=
  ∃ f : X → Y, Function.Bijective f

/-- Example 3.6.2 -/
theorem Example_3_6_2 : EqualCard {0, 1, 2} { 3, 4, 5 } :=
  by
  use open Classical in fun x ↦ ⟨if x.val = 0 then 3 else if x.val = 1 then 4 else 5, by aesop⟩
  constructor
  · intro; aesop
  intro y
  have : y = (3 : Object) ∨ y = (4 : Object) ∨ y = (5 : Object) :=
    by
    have := y.property
    aesop
  rcases this with (_ | _ | _)
  · use ⟨0, by simp⟩; aesop
  · use ⟨1, by simp⟩; aesop
  · use ⟨2, by simp⟩; aesop

/-- Example 3.6.3 -/
theorem Example_3_6_3 : EqualCard nat (nat.specify (fun x ↦ Even (x : ℕ))) := by sorry

@[refl]
theorem refl (X : Set) : EqualCard X X := by sorry

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (h : EqualCard X Y) : EqualCard Y X

ref.pp:
@[symm]
theorem symm {X Y : Set} (h : EqualCard X Y) : EqualCard Y X := by sorry

signature.pp: {X Y Z : Set} (h1 : EqualCard X Y) (h2 : EqualCard Y Z) : EqualCard X Z

ref.pp:
@[trans]
theorem trans {X Y Z : Set} (h1 : EqualCard X Y) (h2 : EqualCard Y Z) : EqualCard X Z := by sorry

/-- Proposition 3.6.4 / Exercise 3.6.1 -/
instance inst_setoid : Setoid SetTheory.Set :=
  ⟨EqualCard, { refl, symm, trans }⟩

/-- Definition 3.6.5 -/
abbrev has_card (X : Set) (n : ℕ) : Prop :=
  X ≈ Fin n

signature.pp: (X : Set) (n : ℕ) : X.has_card n ↔ ∃ f : X → Fin n, Function.Bijective f

ref.pp:
theorem has_card_iff (X : Set) (n : ℕ) : X.has_card n ↔ ∃ f : X → Fin n, Function.Bijective f := by
  simp [has_card, HasEquiv.Equiv, Setoid.r, EqualCard]

signature.pp: (n : ℕ) : (nat.specify (fun x ↦ 1 ≤ (x : ℕ) ∧ (x : ℕ) ≤ n)).has_card n

ref.pp:
/-- Remark 3.6.6 -/
theorem Remark_3_6_6 (n : ℕ) : (nat.specify (fun x ↦ 1 ≤ (x : ℕ) ∧ (x : ℕ) ≤ n)).has_card n := by sorry

/-- Example 3.6.7 -/
theorem Example_3_6_7a (a : Object) : ({ a } : Set).has_card 1 :=
  by
  rw [has_card_iff]
  use fun _ ↦ Fin_mk _ 0 (by simp)
  constructor
  · intro x1 x2 hf; aesop
  intro y
  use ⟨a, by simp⟩
  have := Fin.toNat_lt y
  simp_all

signature.pp:
{a b c d : Object} (hab : a ≠ b) (hac : a ≠ c) (had : a ≠ d) (hbc : b ≠ c) (hbd : b ≠ d) (hcd : c ≠ d) :
  ({ a, b, c, d } : Set).has_card 4

ref.pp:
theorem Example_3_6_7b {a b c d : Object} (hab : a ≠ b) (hac : a ≠ c) (had : a ≠ d) (hbc : b ≠ c) (hbd : b ≠ d)
    (hcd : c ≠ d) : ({ a, b, c, d } : Set).has_card 4 :=
  by
  rw [has_card_iff]
  use
    open Classical in fun x ↦
      Fin_mk _ (if x.val = a then 0 else if x.val = b then 1 else if x.val = c then 2 else 3) (by aesop)
  constructor
  · intro x1 x2 hf; aesop
  intro y
  have : y = (0 : ℕ) ∨ y = (1 : ℕ) ∨ y = (2 : ℕ) ∨ y = (3 : ℕ) :=
    by
    have := Fin.toNat_lt y
    omega
  rcases this with (_ | _ | _ | _)
  · use ⟨a, by aesop⟩; aesop
  · use ⟨b, by aesop⟩; aesop
  · use ⟨c, by aesop⟩; aesop
  · use ⟨d, by aesop⟩; aesop

signature.pp: {n : ℕ} (h : n ≥ 1) {X : Set} (hX : X.has_card n) : X ≠ ∅

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 3.6.9 -/
theorem pos_card_nonempty {n : ℕ} (h : n ≥ 1) {X : Set} (hX : X.has_card n) : X ≠ ∅ := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  by_contra! this
  have hnon : Fin n ≠ ∅ := by apply nonempty_of_inhabited (x := 0); rw [mem_Fin]; use 0, (by omega); rfl
  rw [has_card_iff] at hX
  choose f hf using hX
  sorry
    -- obtain a contradiction from the fact that `f` is a bijection from the empty set to a
      -- non-empty set.

/-- Exercise 3.6.2a -/
theorem has_card_zero {X : Set} : X.has_card 0 ↔ X = ∅ := by sorry

signature.pp: {n : ℕ} (h : n ≥ 1) {X : Set} (hX : X.has_card n) (x : X) : (X \ { x.val }).has_card (n - 1)

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 3.6.9 -/
theorem card_erase {n : ℕ} (h : n ≥ 1) {X : Set} (hX : X.has_card n) (x : X) : (X \ { x.val }).has_card (n - 1) := by
  -- This proof has been rewritten from the original text to try to make it friendlier to
    -- formalize in Lean.
  
  rw [has_card_iff] at hX; choose f hf using hX
  set X' : Set := X \ { x.val }
  set ι : X' → X := fun ⟨y, hy⟩ ↦ ⟨y, by aesop⟩
  observe hι : ∀ x : X', (ι x : Object) = x
  choose m₀ hm₀ hm₀f using (mem_Fin _ _).mp (f x).property
  set g : X' → Fin (n - 1) := fun x' ↦
    let := Fin.toNat_lt (f (ι x'))
    let : (f (ι x') : ℕ) ≠ m₀ := by
      by_contra!; simp [← this, Subtype.val_inj, hf.1.eq_iff, ι] at hm₀f
      have := x'.property; aesop
    if h' : f (ι x') < m₀ then Fin_mk _ (f (ι x')) (by omega) else Fin_mk _ (f (ι x') - 1) (by omega)
  have hg_def (x' : X') : if (f (ι x') : ℕ) < m₀ then (g x' : ℕ) = f (ι x') else (g x' : ℕ) = f (ι x') - 1 := by
    split_ifs with h' <;> simp [g, h']
  have hg : Function.Bijective g := by sorry
  use g

signature.pp: {X : Set} {n m : ℕ} (h1 : X.has_card n) (h2 : X.has_card m) : n = m

ref.pp:
/-- Proposition 3.6.8 (Uniqueness of cardinality) -/
theorem card_uniq {X : Set} {n m : ℕ} (h1 : X.has_card n) (h2 : X.has_card m) : n = m := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  revert X m; induction' n with n hn
  . intro _ _ h1 h2; rw [has_card_zero] at h1; contrapose! h1
    apply pos_card_nonempty _ h2; omega
  intro X m h1 h2
  have : X ≠ ∅ := pos_card_nonempty (by omega) h1
  choose x hx using nonempty_def this
  have : m ≠ 0 := by contrapose! this; simpa [has_card_zero, this] using h2
  specialize hn (card_erase ?_ h1 ⟨_, hx⟩) (card_erase ?_ h2 ⟨_, hx⟩) <;> omega

theorem Example_3_6_8_a : ({0, 1, 2} : Set).has_card 3 :=
  by
  rw [has_card_iff]
  have : ({0, 1, 2} : Set) = SetTheory.Set.Fin 3 := by
    ext x
    simp only [mem_insert, mem_singleton, mem_Fin]
    constructor
    · aesop
    rintro ⟨x, ⟨_, rfl⟩⟩
    simp only [nat_coe_eq_iff]
    omega
  rw [this]
  use id
  exact Function.bijective_id

theorem Example_3_6_8_b : ({ 3, 4 } : Set).has_card 2 :=
  by
  rw [has_card_iff]
  use open Classical in fun x ↦ Fin_mk _ (if x = (3 : Object) then 0 else 1) (by aesop)
  constructor
  · intro x1 x2
    aesop
  intro y
  have := Fin.toNat_lt y
  have : y = (0 : ℕ) ∨ y = (1 : ℕ) := by omega
  aesop

theorem Example_3_6_8_c : ¬({0, 1, 2} : Set) ≈ ({ 3, 4 } : Set) :=
  by
  by_contra h
  have h1 : Fin 3 ≈ Fin 2 := (Example_3_6_8_a.symm.trans h).trans Example_3_6_8_b
  have h2 : Fin 3 ≈ Fin 3 := by rfl
  have := card_uniq h1 h2
  contradiction

abbrev finite (X : Set) : Prop :=
  ∃ n : ℕ, X.has_card n

abbrev infinite (X : Set) : Prop :=
  ¬finite X

signature.pp: {n : ℕ} (f : Fin n → nat) : ∃ M, ∀ i, (f i : ℕ) ≤ M

ref.pp:
/-- Exercise 3.6.3, phrased using Mathlib natural numbers -/
theorem bounded_on_finite {n : ℕ} (f : Fin n → nat) : ∃ M, ∀ i, (f i : ℕ) ≤ M := by sorry

/-- Theorem 3.6.12 -/
theorem nat_infinite : infinite nat := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  by_contra this; choose n hn using this
  simp [has_card] at hn; symm at hn; simp [HasEquiv.Equiv, Setoid.r, EqualCard] at hn
  choose f hf using hn; choose M hM using bounded_on_finite f
  replace hf := hf.surjective ↑(M + 1); contrapose! hf
  peel hM with hi; contrapose! hi
  apply_fun nat_equiv.symm at hi; simp_all

/-- It is convenient for Lean purposes to give infinite sets the ``junk`` cardinality of zero. -/
noncomputable def card (X : Set) : ℕ :=
  if h : X.finite then h.choose else 0

theorem has_card_card {X : Set} (hX : X.finite) : X.has_card (SetTheory.Set.card X) := by
  simp [card, hX, hX.choose_spec]

signature.pp: {X : Set} {n : ℕ} : X.has_card n → X.card = n

ref.pp:
theorem has_card_to_card {X : Set} {n : ℕ} : X.has_card n → X.card = n := by intro h;
  simp [card, card_uniq (⟨n, h⟩ : X.finite).choose_spec h]; aesop

signature.pp: {X : Set} {n : ℕ} (hn : n ≠ 0) : X.card = n → X.has_card n

ref.pp: theorem card_to_has_card {X : Set} {n : ℕ} (hn : n ≠ 0) : X.card = n → X.has_card n := by grind [card, has_card_card]

theorem card_fin_eq (n : ℕ) : (Fin n).has_card n :=
  (has_card_iff _ _).mp ⟨id, Function.bijective_id⟩

theorem Fin_card (n : ℕ) : (Fin n).card = n :=
  has_card_to_card (card_fin_eq n)

theorem Fin_finite (n : ℕ) : (Fin n).finite :=
  ⟨n, card_fin_eq n⟩

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} {n : ℕ} (h : X ≈ Y) : X.has_card n ↔ Y.has_card n

ref.pp:
theorem EquivCard_to_has_card_eq {X Y : Set} {n : ℕ} (h : X ≈ Y) : X.has_card n ↔ Y.has_card n :=
  by
  choose f hf using h; let e := Equiv.ofBijective f hf
  constructor <;> (intro h'; rw [has_card_iff] at *; choose g hg using h')
  . use e.symm.trans (.ofBijective _ hg); apply Equiv.bijective
  . use e.trans (.ofBijective _ hg); apply Equiv.bijective

signature.pp: {X Y : Set} (h : X ≈ Y) : X.card = Y.card

ref.pp:
theorem EquivCard_to_card_eq {X Y : Set} (h : X ≈ Y) : X.card = Y.card :=
  by
  by_cases hX : X.finite <;> by_cases hY : Y.finite <;> try rw [finite] at hX hY
  . choose nX hXn using hX; choose nY hYn using hY
    simp [has_card_to_card hXn, has_card_to_card hYn, EquivCard_to_has_card_eq h] at *
    solve_by_elim [card_uniq]
  . choose nX hXn using hX; rw [EquivCard_to_has_card_eq h] at hXn; tauto
  . choose nY hYn using hY; rw [← EquivCard_to_has_card_eq h] at hYn; tauto
  simp [card, hX, hY]

/-- Exercise 3.6.2 -/
theorem empty_iff_card_eq_zero {X : Set} : X = ∅ ↔ X.finite ∧ X.card = 0 := by sorry

theorem empty_of_card_eq_zero {X : Set} (hX : X.finite) : X.card = 0 → X = ∅ :=
  by
  intro h
  rw [empty_iff_card_eq_zero]
  exact ⟨hX, h⟩

theorem finite_of_empty {X : Set} : X = ∅ → X.finite := by
  intro h
  rw [empty_iff_card_eq_zero] at h
  exact h.1

theorem card_eq_zero_of_empty {X : Set} : X = ∅ → X.card = 0 :=
  by
  intro h
  rw [empty_iff_card_eq_zero] at h
  exact h.2

@[simp]
theorem empty_finite : (∅ : Set).finite :=
  finite_of_empty rfl

@[simp]
theorem empty_card_eq_zero : (∅ : Set).card = 0 :=
  card_eq_zero_of_empty rfl

/-- Exercise 3.6.12 (i), first part -/
theorem Permutations_finite (n : ℕ) : (Permutations n).finite := by
  sorry
    /- To continue Exercise 3.6.12 (i), we'll first develop some theory about `Permutations` and `Fin`. -/

noncomputable def Permutations_toFun {n : ℕ} (p : Permutations n) : (Fin n) → (Fin n) :=
  by
  have := p.property
  simp only [Permutations, specification_axiom'', powerset_axiom] at this
  exact this.choose.choose
theorem Permutations_bijective {n : ℕ} (p : Permutations n) : Function.Bijective (Permutations_toFun p) := by sorry

signature.pp: {n : ℕ} (p1 p2 : Permutations n) : Permutations_toFun p1 = Permutations_toFun p2 ↔ p1 = p2

ref.pp:
theorem Permutations_inj {n : ℕ} (p1 p2 : Permutations n) : Permutations_toFun p1 = Permutations_toFun p2 ↔ p1 = p2 :=
  by sorry

signature.pp: {n : ℕ} : Permutations n ≃ (Fin n ≃ Fin n)

ref.pp:
/-- This connects our concept of a permutation with Mathlib's `Equiv` between `Fin n` and `Fin n`. -/
noncomputable def perm_equiv_equiv {n : ℕ} : Permutations n ≃ (Fin n ≃ Fin n) :=
  { toFun := fun p => Equiv.ofBijective (Permutations_toFun p) (Permutations_bijective p)
    invFun := sorry
    left_inv := sorry
    right_inv := sorry }
    /- Exercise 3.6.12 involves a lot of moving between `Fin n` and `Fin (n + 1)` so let's add some conveniences. -/

/-- Any `Fin (n + 1)` except `n` can be cast to `Fin n`. Compare to Mathlib `Fin.castPred`. -/
noncomputable def castPred {n} (x : Fin (n + 1)) (h : (x : ℕ) ≠ n) : Fin n :=
  Fin_mk _ (x : ℕ) (by have := Fin.toNat_lt x; omega)

  sorry

signature.pp:
{n m : ℕ} {S : Fin n → Set} (hSc : ∀ i, (S i).has_card m) (hSd : Pairwise fun i j => Disjoint (S i) (S j)) :
  ((Fin n).iUnion S).finite ∧ ((Fin n).iUnion S).card = n * m

ref.pp:
/-- Now is a good time to prove this result, which will be useful for completing Exercise 3.6.12 (i). -/
theorem card_iUnion_card_disjoint {n m : ℕ} {S : Fin n → Set} (hSc : ∀ i, (S i).has_card m)
    (hSd : Pairwise fun i j => Disjoint (S i) (S j)) : ((Fin n).iUnion S).finite ∧ ((Fin n).iUnion S).card = n * m := by
  sorry
    /- Finally, we'll set up a way to shrink `Fin (n + 1)` into `Fin n` (or expand the latter) by making a hole. -/

signature.pp: {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : Fin (n + 1)) (h : x ≠ i) : Fin n

ref.pp:
/-- If some `x : Fin (n+1)` is never equal to `i`, we can shrink it into `Fin n` by shifting all `x > i` down by one.
  Compare to Mathlib `Fin.predAbove`.
-/
noncomputable def predAbove {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : Fin (n + 1)) (h : x ≠ i) : Fin n :=
  if hx : (x : ℕ) < i then Fin_mk _ (x : ℕ) (by sorry) else Fin_mk _ ((x : ℕ) - 1) (by sorry)

/-- We can expand `x : Fin n` into `Fin (n + 1)` by shifting all `x ≥ i` up by one.
  The output is never `i`, so it forms an inverse to the shrinking done by `predAbove`.
  Compare to Mathlib `Fin.succAbove`.
-/
noncomputable def succAbove {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : Fin n) : Fin (n + 1) :=
  if (x : ℕ) < i then Fin_embed _ _ (by sorry) x else Fin_mk _ ((x : ℕ) + 1) (by sorry)

signature.pp: {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : Fin n) : succAbove i x ≠ i

ref.pp:
@[simp]
theorem succAbove_ne {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : Fin n) : succAbove i x ≠ i := by sorry

signature.pp: {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : Fin (n + 1)) (h : x ≠ i) : (succAbove i) (predAbove i x h) = x

ref.pp:
@[simp]
theorem succAbove_predAbove {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : Fin (n + 1)) (h : x ≠ i) : (succAbove i) (predAbove i x h) = x :=
  by sorry

signature.pp: {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : Fin n) : (predAbove i) (succAbove i x) (succAbove_ne i x) = x

ref.pp:
@[simp]
theorem predAbove_succAbove {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : Fin n) : (predAbove i) (succAbove i x) (succAbove_ne i x) = x :=
  by sorry

/-- Exercise 3.6.12 (i), second part -/
theorem Permutations_ih (n : ℕ) : (Permutations (n + 1)).card = (n + 1) * (Permutations n).card :=
  by
  let S i := (Permutations (n + 1)).specify (fun p ↦ perm_equiv_equiv p (Fin.last n) = i)
  have hSe : ∀ i, S i ≈ Permutations n := by
    intro i
    have equiv : S i ≃ Permutations n := sorry
    use equiv, equiv.injective, equiv.surjective
  sorry

/-- Exercise 3.6.12 (ii) -/
theorem Permutations_card (n : ℕ) : (Permutations n).card = n.factorial := by sorry

/-- Connections with Mathlib's `Finite` -/
theorem finite_iff_finite {X : Set} : X.finite ↔ Finite X :=
  by
  rw [finite_iff_exists_equiv_fin, finite]
  constructor
  · rintro ⟨n, hn⟩
    use n
    obtain ⟨f, hf⟩ := hn
    have eq := (Equiv.ofBijective f hf).trans (Fin.Fin_equiv_Fin n)
    exact ⟨eq⟩
  rintro ⟨n, hn⟩
  use n
  have eq := hn.some.trans (Fin.Fin_equiv_Fin n).symm
  exact ⟨eq, eq.bijective⟩

/-- Connections with Mathlib's `Set.Finite` -/
theorem finite_iff_set_finite {X : Set} : X.finite ↔ (X : _root_.Set Object).Finite :=
  by
  rw [finite_iff_finite]
  rfl

/-- Connections with Mathlib's `Nat.card` -/
theorem card_eq_nat_card {X : Set} : X.card = Nat.card X :=
  by
  by_cases hf : X.finite
  · by_cases hz : X.card = 0
    · rw [hz]; symm
      have : X = ∅ := empty_of_card_eq_zero hf hz
      rw [this, Nat.card_eq_zero, isEmpty_iff]
      aesop
    symm
    have hc := has_card_card hf
    obtain ⟨f, hf⟩ := hc
    apply Nat.card_eq_of_equiv_fin
    exact (Equiv.ofBijective f hf).trans (Fin.Fin_equiv_Fin X.card)
  simp only [card, hf, ↓reduceDIte]; symm
  rw [Nat.card_eq_zero, ← not_finite_iff_infinite]
  right
  rwa [finite_iff_set_finite] at hf

/-- Connections with Mathlib's `Set.ncard` -/
theorem card_eq_ncard {X : Set} : X.card = (X : _root_.Set Object).ncard :=
  by
  rw [card_eq_nat_card]
  rfl
